  • Method Details

    • verify

      public boolean verify(@NonNull String packageName, @NonNull URI uri) throws AndroidAppPackageVerifier.CouldNotVerifyPackageException
      Verify that the specified app package is covered by a reliable statement in the Asset Links JSON for the provided URI.

      NOTE: this method performs blocking network activity; it should not be invoked on the UI thread of an app. A running instance of this function can be cancelled (from another thread using the URISourceVerifier.cancel() method.

      Parameters:
      packageName - the android app package name (e.g. com.solana.example)
      uri - the URI with which this app package should be verified. This should be a URI that establishes a trust link of interest to the app. For example, if the use case is a Solana Pay transaction request, the URI might refer to the site which is generating the transaction.
      Returns:
      true if the package was verified using the specified URI, or false if it was not verified
      Throws:
      AndroidAppPackageVerifier.CouldNotVerifyPackageException - if the package verification process was not successful. Note that this doesn't necessarily imply that the package was not verified, but rather that a relationship could not be established.
